name: Johan Grimonprez
biography: Johan Grimonprez’ dial H-I-S-T-O-R-Y (1997), garnered ‘best director’ awards at the San Fransisco Filmfestival and Images Toronto. Since its premiere at the Centre Georges Pompidou (Paris) and the Documenta X (Kassel), the film has travelled to numerous venues worldwide, and is now released on home-DVD, accompanied by contributions from novelist Don Delillo and cultural theorist, Slavoj Zizek; distributed by D.A.P. (New York) and Imageforum (Tokyo). A current faculty member at the School of Visual Arts (New York), Johan Grimonprez’ work resides at the Tate Modern (London), the Kanazawa Art Museum (Japan), and is acquired by Channel 4 (U.K.) and Arte (Germany/France).  He has curated new media projects for venues such as the Musee d’Art Moderne (Paris) and the Whitney Museum (New York); and published Inflight (2000) with Hatje/Cantz (Germany). His website www.zapomatik.com investigates our curious habit of zapping in relation to the commercial break. ZAP-O-MATIK will also produce his new film ZUNK® currently being developed at the Maurits Binger Film Institute (Amsterdam) and supported by the Flemish Filmfund (VAF, Brussels). CURRENT AT DECEMBER 2004
